channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #47 - YAPC::EU and Moose Hackathon sign-up deadlines soon!
item.description:
Hi,

YAPC::NA is over and I am writing this from a friend's place near Milwaukee. This is a very good friend from my high-school years whom, I have not seen for 15 years. I stayed with his family before the conference and came back for a few more days. I enjoy being with them very much and I don't know how many years will pass till I can see them again!

There are not many items this week, as many of the regular authors were busy at YAPC::NA, but reports about the confrence started to appear, so I am including some of them.

YAPC::EU is getting closer. The deadline to submit talk proposals is 15th July. Right after YAPC::EU you can also participate at the Moose Hackathon organized by the Oslo Perl Mongers. The deadline to sign up to the hackathon is 25th June! Just a week from now. It looks awesome (as all the other events the Oslo.PM organizes). Check it out!

Now to the posts...

item.title: Inviting to the Moving to Moose Hackathon 2012
item.description: Salve Nielsen and the Oslo Perl Mongers are organizing another event. I have been to two events they organized and both were extremely good. And this one, well, just look at the picture. The best location ever. (Though I don't know how can you do any hacking there.)

item.title: NoCOUG contest: a gentler, saner solution
item.description: Yanick provides a detailed solution for the Party Planner project.

item.title: Perl without IRC
item.description: How does the Perl world look like to the 95% of people who are not using IRC? asked chromatic. They are missing out on a lot of conversations. They are not kept up-to-date with the latest trends of the Perl community. (Which might be actually good sometimes.) The Perl Weekly is actually trying to fill the void a bit, but it is far from a perfect solution.

item.title: A Perl PDL Demonstration Using the Hill Cipher Algorithm
item.description: Christopher Frenz

item.title: Announcing Marpa::R2
item.description: It seems there was a lull in news about Marpa - the new parsing algorithm, but now Jeffrey Kegler has announced this new, alpha version of the package. This is faster then the previous versions and does not require Glib.

item.title: How many of your dists are in Debian?
item.description: Steven Haryanto wrote a script using Mojo::DOM to fetch the list of modules an individual author has in Debian. Several others quickly replied with examples how to fetch this information from MetaCPAN.

item.title: (xxxiii) stackoverflow perl report
item.description: The weekly link collection by Miguel Prz (niceperl)

item.title: Read Beginner Perl by Ovid online for free
item.description: Ovid mentiones that his new, not-yet-published book is now available free of charge for on-line readers. Go read it while it is available.

item.title: My date bug or not so consistent consistency
item.description: An interesting story in which Viacheslav Tykhanovskyi (vti) is surprised by the different behavior of Time::Local on perl 5.10 and perl 5.14.

item.title: An Arduino/Dancer-enabled mobile-enhanced door
item.description: An exercise in design by Sawyer making changes to the real world.

item.title: Oficially a Hardware Hacker
item.description: MDK participated in the Hardware workshop Robert Blackwell ran at YAPC::NA and got hooked.

item.title: Paul Johnson, Devel::Cover Grant Report for May
Modern Perl for Non-Perl Programmers (Redux)
item.description: Dave Cross is running another one-day training class on 6th October 2002 in London. If you know anyone who might be interested, please forward the link.

item.title: Reflecting on YAPC::NA 2012
item.description: by Joel Berger

item.title: My YAPC::NA 2012 Madison
item.description: by Reini Urban

item.title: YAPC::NA 2012
item.description: by Tim Heaney (oylenshpeegul)

item.title: Lunch++
item.description: Originally suggested by brian d foy, MDK wants to take the idea of 'Lunch with a celebrity' one step further and get it more organized. I personally had ambivalent feelings about the Lunch project when brian asked if I'd like to participate. I don't think I am a 'celebrity' though I certainly make a lot of noise so relatively many people heard my name. OTOH, I like to have lunch with and talk to new people. OT3H I am so bad at names and faces, I'd be embarrassed the next day when I don't recognize the same person.

item.title: YAPC::NA 2012 Aftermath
item.description: Kartik Thakore is planning to spend 3-4 hours a week to improve the Avenger game.

item.title: My Bingo Results at YAPC::NA 2012
item.description: Sawyer X suggested the bingo idea to JT and he was the one who completed it during the closing session of the lightning talks.

item.title: our Campaign Secrets rules from YAPC 2006
item.description: This is basically only interesting to people who attended YAPC::NA and how received the cards in the welcome bag. RJBS shows an improved set of rules for the game.
